responses.rationale: Describes a safeguard/process ('may be imported under a veterinary permit') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a safeguard/measure ('Imports... will also be suspended') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a response measure/safeguard ('have been culled') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a factual outcome ('Birds often die') not capability/preparedness.
Describes a response measure/safeguard ('are also culled to control the spread') without explicit reassurance.
Describes economic impact ('sent prices... to record highs, worsening economic pain').
Describes spread/impact ('infected flocks... across 46 states').
Describes transmission mechanism ('Wild birds... transmit the virus').
Describes a recommended safeguard/measure ('preventing contact... is critical to protecting') without explicit reassurance.
Describes safeguards/preparedness ('increasing security and cleaning measures') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a finding from investigation ('cases... were traced directly').
Describes impact/statistics ('account for more than 70 percent').
Contains explicit reassurance ('poses a low risk to the general public').
Describes a surveillance/preparedness measure ('Testing... will continue') without explicit reassurance.
Describes surveillance/preparedness ('Testing... will continue') and safeguards ('under quarantine') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a preparedness/response action ('have reached out... to schedule testing') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a factual event/finding ('first confirmation... since 2020').
Describes impact/statistics ('affected 11 poultry farms, resulting in the loss').
Describes impact (human cases) ('Seven people... also developed symptoms').
Describes a response action/measure ('are undergoing further tests') without explicit reassurance.
Describes impact/potential spread ('possible cluster... has grown... may be the first examples').
Describes a potential future possibility/risk ('could indicate that the virus may have acquired the ability') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a factual condition (low frequency) ('clusters... are extremely rare').
Describes transmission mechanism ('Most cases have resulted from close contact').
Describes potential spread/impact ('patient may have infected one household member').
Expresses concern/opinion ('We should be very concerned').
Describes impact/statistics ('There have been 13 other confirmed cases').
Describes transmission mechanism/source ('cases were all acquired from interactions').
Describes a preparedness/surveillance measure ('tested as part of routine flu surveillance') without explicit reassurance.

Describes factual impact ('no H5N1-related deaths reported', 'most cases have been relatively mild') and hopeful possibility ('suggesting that the virus does not have the high mortality rate') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a limitation/uncertainty ('makes it difficult to estimate its virulence').
Describes a pattern/observation ('health care workers are often an early sign').
Expresses potential future concern ('would definitely increase my level of alarm').
Describes impact (human case) ('someone... had developed gastrointestinal symptoms').
Describes a response action/measure ('added four more health care workers to the list') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a capability/process ('Epidemiologists can get a lot of information') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a perception/opinion ('tone... has also been unduly optimistic').
Describes a perception/opinion ('messaging... has been maybe a little more confident and a little more placating').
Describes a potential future possibility/recommendation ('would help clarify how the virus might have spread') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a risk/potential future negative possibility ('could set off the next pandemic').
Describes a challenge/difficulty ('may muddy the picture further, making it difficult to identify').
Uses a metaphor to describe difficulty/challenge ('needle in a stack of needles').
Describes a surveillance finding ('Wastewater analyses have shown H5N1 spikes') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a potential finding from surveillance ('We would see a really consistent wastewater signal') without explicit reassurance.
Expresses a need for action/recommendation ('We need to get this thing out') without explicit reassurance.
Expresses a need for action/recommendation ('we really need to take decisive action') without explicit reassurance.
Describes risks/concerns ('is a concern... due to the devastation... possibility of trade restrictions and a risk').
Describes impact/statistics ('unprecedented number of outbreaks... causing massive mortality').
Describes transmission mechanism ('It is transmitted by infected migrating wild birds' faeces').
Describes impact/spread ('affected 37 European countries... largest geographical reach... causing a severe epidemic').
Describes impact/statistics ('187 detections were notified... 3,573 HPAI events were recorded').
Describes recommended measures/strategies ('recommended rapid implementation of risk mitigation and surveillance strategies') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a future possibility/process ('trial would likely focus') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a capability/plan ('contract includes options to accelerate the development timeline') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a limitation/uncertainty about capability ('too early to tell how many doses... will be able to manufacture').
Describes a concern/potential future negative possibility ('could increase the risk... touching off a pandemic').
Contains explicit reassurance ('The risk to the general public from bird flu remains low').
Describes a future possibility/plan ('expects to have more announcements') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a characteristic of a capability (vaccine technology) ('use messenger RNA') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a capability/process ('can take four to six months') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a hopeful future possibility ('could be available as early as this month') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a potential future use/plan ('could potentially be used to inoculate') without explicit reassurance.
Contains explicit reassurance (direct food safety assurance) ('pasteurization inactivates the bird flu virus').
Describes surveillance ('conducting ongoing tests') and a recommendation/safeguard ('cautioned against consuming raw milk') without explicit reassurance.
Describes impact (human case) ('A person... has tested positive').
Describes a response/treatment ('is being treated with antiviral medication') and a positive outcome ('is recovering') without explicit reassurance.
Describes spread/impact ('It has also infected mammalian species').
Describes spread/impact ('infections have been found in cattle').
Contains explicit reassurance ('the risk to the public remains low').
Describes impact/statistics ('second known to occur').
Describes impact/statistics and transmission source ('second known to occur', 'tested positive... after having direct contact').
Describes impact/outcome ('reported mild fatigue and later recovered').
Describes historical context/comparison ('Previous cases... were deadly, but they involved a different form').
Describes an interview topic ('talked to Michael Osterholm... about the latest human case').
Describes a past case finding process/surveillance ('someone who was tested routinely', 'they just got tested') without explicit reassurance.
Poses a question about future possibility/risk ('How likely is the virus to spread').
Contains explicit reassurance ('there is low risk for humans').
Describes a potential sentinel species for surveillance ('pigs would be the animal species that... would be the sentinel') without explicit reassurance.
Poses a question about a factual observation ('Why is H5N1 causing milder human infections').
Describes historical impact ('Previously there have been fatal cases').
Describes historical impact and poses a question about risk ('fatal cases... What does that tell us about the risk').
Expresses historical perspective ('We’ve been here before').
Describes historical impact/context ('that was when we saw the major increase in cases').
Describes historical impact/statistics ('there were [hundreds of] cases').
Describes historical prediction/concern ('thought was that... ‘it’s just imminent now’').
Recommendation for vigilance/surveillance ('you have to keep your eye on it') without explicit reassurance.
Uses a metaphor to express need for vigilance/preparedness attitude ('sleep with one eye open') without explicit reassurance.
Describes biological mechanism and impact ('cause human infection... was obviously a severe issue').
Describes a finding from investigation/contact tracing ('exposures were [traced] back to the animals') without explicit reassurance.
Poses a question about transmission source ('Did the current case... likely involve').
Expresses possibility regarding transmission source ('that could very well be').
Discusses potential transmission sources and confirms animal exposure ('clearly an animal exposure') without explicit reassurance.
Poses a question about detection/surveillance ('How would we know if the virus was spreading').
Describes the process of detecting wider spread/surveillance ('start picking up additional human cases') without explicit reassurance.
Poses a question about surveillance/monitoring ('Are scientists watching H5N1 closely').
Describes surveillance/monitoring activity ('We’re going to be tracking the virus') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a surveillance/investigation activity ('looking at the epidemiology') without explicit reassurance.
Poses a question about transmission route/risk ('Could people become infected by consuming').
Recommendation/safeguard ('unpasteurized milk and cheeses I would surely avoid') without explicit reassurance.
Recommendation/safeguard ('unpasteurized milk and cheeses I would surely avoid') without explicit reassurance.
Contains explicit reassurance (direct food safety assurance) ('pasteurization will kill the virus').
Poses a question about transmission route/risk ('could you actually become infected by drinking milk').
Poses a question about biological mechanism/transmission ('Will taking the virus down your throat... cause the exposure').
Poses a question about economic impact ('How is the fact that H5N1 is infecting cows... likely to affect').
Expresses future possibility (gaining knowledge) ('we’ll know in the weeks ahead') without explicit reassurance.
Describes an expected pattern/risk factor ('expect to see migratory birds bringing the virus').
Expresses uncertainty ('We don't know') and a need for preparedness ('need to be better prepared') without explicit reassurance.
Describes recommended response measures ('should include targeted conservation funding as well as compensation') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a past situation/perception ('threat of Covid has receded').
Describes a current situation/concern ('one pandemic has not received enough attention').
Describes a safeguard/action taken ('took action to control the spread... by ordering... to be confined indoors') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a response action/measure ('have culled millions of chickens') without explicit reassurance.
Describes impact ('A bigger toll is falling').
Describes spread/transmission mechanism ('H5N1 flu strain has spread around the world').
Describes historical pattern of the outbreak ('current outbreak first appeared... unusually persisted').
Describes a factor affecting spread ('natural crowding... only accelerates contagion').
Describes impact/finding ('record hundreds of dead birds washing up').
Expresses concern ('Scientists worry about').
Describes potential future impact ('poultry sector will also be hit').
Describes economic impact ('industry has been passing on higher poultry costs').
Describes a potential future response/measure ('authorities will relax marketing rules so that frozen turkeys... can be sold') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a response measure/support ('Farmers will receive compensation') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a recommended future action/support ('should also find funds to help... recover') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a person and their job history.
Describes an action taken related to organizational function/capability ('time has been spent repairing relations') without explicit reassurance.
Describes an action taken (interview) ('Marrazzo sat for an interview').
Expresses willingness to discuss ('I’m happy to talk about things').
Describes source of information ('what people have wanted to... has been from CDC').
Describes personal process/understanding ('needed to get my head around what this job is about').
Describes personal preference ('She doesn’t want to do interviews comparing herself').
Describes an entity ('You’ve inherited a very important research institute').
Describes a job function/capability ('what I call scientific diplomacy') without explicit reassurance.
Describes an action taken/priority related to organizational function/capability ('take a look at some of the relationships') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a past situation/challenge ('being the only NIH institute being cut').

Describes actions taken related to organizational function/capability ('working with our legislative staff, trying to get to know people... trying to create relationships') without explicit reassurance.
Describes personal history/experience ('spent the last seven years... in a deeply red state').
Describes a perception/characterization ('I would say it’s a restart').
Expresses a recommendation/approach ('We need to not admonish people').
Describes past practice/availability related to organizational function/capability ('people were really used to an NIAID director who was very available') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a current practice/approach related to organizational function/capability ('now it is generally one of the scientists') without explicit reassurance.
Poses a question about discussion topic ('Can we talk about H5N1').
Expresses concern ('I am concerned').
Describes an approach/attitude related to response/preparedness ('There has been an effort to be really cautious') without explicit reassurance.
Describes an action/approach related to response/communication ('CDC’s kept their assessment... fairly constant') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a current state/context ('we are in a hangover period from Covid').
Describes a limitation/constraint related to response capability ('we can’t mandate mask-wearing') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a past event/reaction ('there was a fair amount of disturbance').
Describes a perception/desire ('people just want to live a normal life').
Describes a current state/feeling ('We’re still all traumatized').
Describes a current state/feeling ('We’re still all traumatized').
Describes a current state/feeling ('None of us are over that').
Describes a current attitude/limitation ('not a lot of appetite for raising an alarm').
Poses a question about desired information/surveillance ('Would we like more information').
Describes a potential risk/uncertainty ('wisps of a hint of a potential... of person-to-person spread').
Describes a finding from research related to understanding the virus/preparedness ('seeing in animal models that there is transmissibility') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a surveillance system related to preparedness/capability ('CDC has this sentinel surveillance') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a surveillance system related to preparedness/capability ('CDC has this sentinel surveillance') without explicit reassurance.
Expresses concern about detection capability ('worry there’s going to be delayed diagnosis and delayed detection').
Describes a limitation of surveillance systems related to capability ('may not show up in your regular surveillance systems') without explicit reassurance.
Introduces a topic ('wanted to ask you about is mpox').
Poses a question about control capability ('do you think this new clade Ib outbreak is stoppable').
Uses a metaphor to describe spread mechanism ('viruses found the HOV lane').

Uses a metaphor to describe spread mechanism ('viruses found the HOV lane') and expresses opinion about control capability ('I don’t think you can put it back into the box') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a limitation in understanding/surveillance related to capability ('don’t even think we know what the magnitude of the problem is') without explicit reassurance.

Describes potential future actions/planning related to response strategy/capability ('blunt the pace', 'take a step back', 'figure out what the next phase of control can be') without explicit reassurance.

Describes a constraint on research methods due to an existing intervention related to research capability/limitations ('because of the existence of effective pre-exposure prophylaxis... you can’t do placebo-controlled trials') without explicit reassurance.
Describes progress in research/understanding related to research capability ('figuring out how to do it', 'amazing papers out') without explicit reassurance.
Describes progress/potential in research related to research capability/future possibility ('field is getting really exciting in terms of understanding and training') without explicit reassurance.

Expresses uncertainty about timing ('don’t know if it’s going to be two years') but hope for future breakthroughs ('feel like there are some incipient breakthroughs') related to research capability/future possibility without explicit reassurance.

Poses a question about resource allocation/strategy given an existing intervention related to response strategy/capability ('why should we focus on vaccines... when we have now lenacapavir') without explicit reassurance.

Describes a characteristic/limitation of an existing intervention related to intervention capability/applicability ('designed for men’s sexual pleasure... very different for women') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a topic of discussion related to organizational planning/capability ('having a strategic vision for NIAID') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a plan/process related to organizational planning/capability ('want a living document that’s going to be refreshed annually, and we’ll have individual pages') without explicit reassurance.
Poses a question about metrics/surveillance/assessment related to capability/preparedness ('What are the metrics for H5N1') without explicit reassurance.
Expresses a hopeful future possibility/goal ('would love to see the promise of the malaria interventions realized') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a past achievement in research related to research capability ('included these women in the study is such a signal achievement') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a potential future possibility/outcome from research related to research capability/future possibility ('could create a path for serious control') without explicit reassurance.
Expresses hopeful future possibility related to research/control capability ('Hopefully we’ll make some inroads') without explicit reassurance.
Expresses personal opinion/hesitation ('I wish I could 100% buy into that idea').
Expresses a hopeful future possibility/goal related to research/intervention capability ('we can aim for some incredible game-changing interventions') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a finding from surveillance/testing related to detection capability ('Avian influenza was discovered') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a response action/measure ('nearly 2 million chickens will have been culled') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a factual statistic (population size) ('had a broiler chicken population amounting to 138 million head').
Describes historical event/response ('91,000 chickens were culled') without explicit reassurance.
Describes historical event/response ('1.67 million chickens were culled') without explicit reassurance.
Describes current situation/response related to surveillance/response measures ('Bird flu is being reported', 'confirming another case', 'led to the culling') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a planned response action/measure ('authorities will cull nearly 140,000 turkey and chickens') without explicit reassurance.
Describes historical event/statistics ('was the country's second case').
Describes spread/impact ('Bird flu cases have also appeared').
Describes a safeguard/measure ('was in a 3-kilometre sanitary radius') and a planned future action ('authorities would decide on possible culling') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a consequence of a safeguard ('FREE-RANGE eggs will disappear').
Describes a safeguard ('Chickens have been in bird flu lockdown') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a rule/process related to consequence of safeguard ('eggs must now be marketed as "barn eggs"').
Describes a response action ('supermarkets will put up signs') and a future possibility ('eggs will go back to being free-range') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a consequence of a safeguard (labelling change) and the purpose of the safeguard ('to protect their health and welfare') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a future possibility/condition for lifting safeguards ('Once the risk levels have reduced... birds will be able to go outside again') without explicit reassurance.
Describes research/development capability ('France has been trialling bird flu vaccines') without explicit reassurance.
States a goal/purpose of measures ('Protect health and welfare') without explicit reassurance.
Describes reaction/concern ('developments... have raised concerns').
Describes impact/finding ('both reported outbreaks').
Describes impact/findings ('include infected dairy cows and the first known instance').
Describes attitude/knowledge base related to preparedness/capability ('agency is taking bird flu seriously', 'virus has already been well studied') without explicit reassurance.
Describes knowledge base/preparedness ('This is known to us', 'we’ve been studying it', 'we’ve been preparing for avian flu for 20 years') without explicit reassurance.
Describes virus characteristic/evolution ('it has evolved over time, spawning newer versions').
Describes spread/impact ('virus has been spreading among more animal species').
Describes detection/spread related to surveillance findings ('has been detected in wild birds') without explicit reassurance.
Describes impact (deaths) and response (killed to stop spread) ('been killed to stop outbreaks from spreading') without explicit reassurance.
Describes detection/spread related to surveillance findings ('it had been discovered in dairy herds') without explicit reassurance.
Describes historical event/identification ('first identified as a threat to people').
Describes historical impact/statistics ('nearly 900 people have been diagnosed... and more than 460 people have died').
Describes impact/statistics (low number, non-fatal) ('only two cases... and neither were fatal').
Describes impact/outcome (mild, recovery) ('His only symptom was fatigue, and he recovered').
Describes impact/symptoms (mild) ('Their only reported symptom was eye redness').
Describes symptoms ('Symptoms are similar to that of other flus').
Describes transmission pattern ('it spread within families').
Describes uncertainty about impact and expresses concern ('too early to quantify the potential economic impact... developments are concerning').
Uses a metaphor to describe lack of a safeguard/limitation related to capability limitation ('don’t have a magic forcefield') without explicit reassurance.
Expresses concern about economic impact ('There is a concern in terms of how this might impact other markets').
Describes potential future negative impacts (economic, reputational) ('consumers could ultimately see higher prices', 'industries could experience "reputational strain"').
Describes current economic impact/situation ('egg industry already is experiencing some tightening of supply').
Describes factual statistics (population size, price) ('estimated 310 million egg-laying hens', 'wholesale egg prices are down').
Describes a safeguard/measure taken by another country ('Colombia has restricted the import') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a historical event (first country to limit trade) and economic impact ('first country to officially limit trade... broadening economic impact').
Describes a factual statistic (import amount) ('Colombia imports a small amount of beef').
Describes a safeguard/measure taken by another country ('Colombia imposed temporary restrictions') without explicit reassurance.
Describes a process/consequence related to safeguard implementation ('shipments may still be held at the port') without explicit reassurance.
